intro: Chrysocoma obscura, commonly known as the dark chrysocoma, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in shrubland or woodland habitats. Chrysocoma obscura is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological role.
